embeds.title: Incorporeal
embeds.description:
Uncommon Skill / 0 :energy_hexa: / The Hexaghost / Downfall

**Retract.**
Lose 5 (3) HP.
Gain 1 **Intangible** :p_intangible:.
**Exhaust**.

messages.content: Ah yes the 'I win with 2 or more of these' card.
OP
This could be moved to rare.
I would happily take it over some rares.
In fact, some of the rares could be nerfed into uncommons, and cards like this could be moved to rare.
who wants to draft apparitions in uncommon?
I'm gonna use this thread to talk about rarity.
Incorporeal and Bright Ritual should just be rare.
They are rare power level and I can easily compare them to other rare cards.
Swap rarity with time warp
Time Warp is literally one of the best cards on the character.
Time warp is as rare as they come.
by a lot.
it's just literal free energy.
Effect is similar to cards like <flurry of blows>. I always took rare cards as "More complex".

messages.content: Its power level is also insanely high.
You rarely if ever skip time warp.
you can be saving 3, 4 energy per turn with time warp.
it makes your ghostflames go twice as fast unironically
<time warp> <bright ritual>

embeds.description:

messages.content: Volcano Visage could have its power level tooled down into an uncommon, and so could incineration.
I've just always felt that rare cards should be generally more powerful, but have specific mechanics needed to get the most out of them.
Burning Question and Floatwork were massively buffed right before release. 5 Strength is way too much, and so is 5 plated.
Nah Time Warp is like, a top five card on hexa.
It's  just free energy, it should be rare.
Like <exhume> needing exhaust. Or <Brilliance> needing you to play watcher.

**Exhaust**.

Deals additional damage equal to Mantra :p_mantra: gained this combat.

messages.content: If it's a must pick in every deck, maybe it should be nerfed slightly?
its not a must pick when compared to other rares.
even if it was made into an uncommon that did 1 damage I would always be taking something over skip.
unless I already had two of them
and the issue with incorporeal specifically is that you're never skipping when it shows up, which means it should be rare
Fair enough. I suppose I just think of rares in an odd way.

Yeah,  I would make Incineration 3 damage 3 soulburn and Volcano Visage 3 (5) Soulburn, then move Incorporeal and Bright  Ritual to rare, then Burning Question to 2 (3) Strength like it used to be, then Floatwork to 2 (3) Plated to make up for the Dex buff on it.
Opposing Action +1 Energy + Exhaust, Devil's Dance + Ethereal upgrade removes Ethereal instead of 1 cost, Devour Flame requires the flame behind to be ignited to retract.
Also Naughty Spirit to  4 (6) Soulburn.
You could also argue Step Through to rare, but it's currently acting as a bit of a glue card right now.
Empowered  Flame to 2 (3) like it used to is also worth talking about, since it's meant to be the boring defragment style power.
<empowered flame>

messages.content: Oh, and the upgrade for the nightmare cards should upgrade the value on the card instead of the token.

messages.content: Ok I'm pretty sure that's meant to give <Master Reality> a niche

embeds.title: Master Reality
embeds.description:
Rare Power / 1 (0) :purple_energy: / The Watcher / Slay the Spire

Whenever a card is created during combat, **Upgrade** it.

messages.content: none of the shiv creating cards upgrade the shivs except for storm of steel
nor do any of the cards that make other cards
Yeah it's just one example in vanilla
Upgrading the token made more sense with the old nightmare cards

I thought that the life loss and retract would be enough of a drawback for this to be somewhat reasonable, but between the sustain of the 1st and 6th seals, and the very real potential to turn retract into a positive with the right synergies (as well as being able to take 2-3 retract cards in a normal wheel deck and play them sparingly) incorporeal has definitely felt too strong as an uncommon draftable apparition (and you really like taking the apparition event on hexaghost anyways). Like with shape of puddle before it, I think this should be moved up to rare as well, since the defensive value of the effect is just so high. Being able to negate nearly all incoming damage for one turn for 0 energy is incredibly strong, and you can too easily get multiple of these because it's an uncommon. I do like the idea of a ghost character having a source of intangible in their card pool, it's very fitting. The upgrade is usually a non-factor, you don't really need it, it's a single use card, and while it's nice to lower the damage, you normally have enough sustain to be fine either way. A cost related upgrade might be a better idea, having it cost 1 normally, and upgrade down to a 0 cost (possibly lowering the life loss alongside the cost increase). It's worth noting that this is quite powerful with recycler (as are unupgraded apparitions), letting you double dip on the value. Great with pyramid to hold onto it for the right turn and lessen the drawback on retract. Any sustain relics are very helpful to ease the life loss.

I I could definitely see volcano visage moved down to uncommon, not so sure on incineration. Burning question probably shouldn't give 5 strength, but it is a 2 cost, so I'm not quite sure where the right level for it is. Floatwork is pretty strong right now, but I think 2 (4) would be a more conservative nerf to start. Plated Armor is very difficult to balance well, since too little easily falls off, and too much protects itself too well.
<incineration>

embeds.title: Incineration
embeds.description:
Rare Attack / 2 :energy_hexa: / The Hexaghost / Downfall

Deal 5 damage and apply 5 **Soulburn** :p_soulburn: 3 (4) times.

messages.content: My issue with floatwork is that the dex AND plated armor take it over the top.
It's +6 Block on Ghost Shield atm.

Naughty spirit is definitely dealing too much damage right now, that makes sense, I don't think I would make step through rare, but I could see adding exhaust to it so it's single use. I think the relatively limited nature of intensity (only applying to the wheel) justifies empowered flame being a bit stronger than normal at 3 (4).
Step Through could probably go to 6 (8) Damage maybe.
Compile Driver is already like, an A tier Defect card.
Step Through is just "compile driver but better"
and it's kind of acting as a bit of a glue card right now
making step through exhaust sounds pretty cursed and also not fun
it would be like if <compile driver>

Deal 7 (10) damage.

messages.content: said "draw 1 card per orb" but also exhausted
Compile driver drawing a card for each channeled orb would be as strong as Step Through but honestly probably stronger.
like, a lot stronger.
draw 10 is just free.
I think that with incineration it can just be made into "sword boomerang stapled with soulburn boomerang" which is just how it currently acts with but with a TON of frontload on it
It's a respectable rare for sure but it could work as uncommon and I don't think incorporeal or bright ritual can be nerfed to proper uncommon levl
without like, -10 hp on incorporeal, which isn't really fun
yes
besides, bright ritual is essentially Hexa's <Fission>

embeds.title: Fission
embeds.description:
Rare Skill / 0 :blue_energy: / The Defect / Slay the Spire

Remove (Evoke) all your Orbs. Gain :blue_energy: and draw 1 card for each Orb removed (Evoked).
**Exhaust**.

messages.content:
Lowering the damage on step through makes sense as well, it's such a strong source of card draw, so making it less effective as as frontloaded damage card for the early game is a good way to balance it out and clarify it's role. 

After checking, there are a decent number of "strong attacks" at rare for hexaghost, so I could definitely see moving incineration down to uncommon and making it a sword boomerang effect with soulburn. It's not that unique or powerful of a card, and I do agree that both bright ritual and incorporeal would make a lot more sense and be better balanced at rare.

imo something like 2(4) str 1 dex might be ok
2(3) feels too low for a 2c, you're paying too much premium for the ability to infinitely scale
5 str 1 dex is way too high for sure, 5 str for 2 cost is already an excellent deal in powers
It should be slightly worse than an equivalent power while not feeling too garbage
possibly might want 1c 0(1) str 1 dex?
but then it feels too low impact
it used to be 1 cost 2 strength (3 strength) 1 dex but it was knocked down in the beta for being objectively better inflame
yeah even 1c 1(2) str 1 dex feels too much stronger than inflame imo
Something else was the comparison point initially
now its just a card with strange numbers
5 strength is a LOT.
5 str with multihits or 0cs wins runs plenty yeah
let alone being able to replay it
also, I've noted that the now 2 sources of dexterity makes gifts from beyond more "creative ai" than "white noise" atm
<hello world> perhaps?
